text: Taqueria el jardín is inside of a neighborhood bodega, so while you wait for your delectable grub, you can find all the double priced boxes of pasta your heart desires.  I've had the steak burrito with avocado and a torta here; both were phenomenal, and if you live in a walking distance of this establishment, you have got to come here. Interestingly they also serve fried chicken that sits in a glass container all day, which I don't really understand who buys that, but maybe one day I'll take the plunge. Nonetheless, you can't go wrong with this spot if you're craving Mexican food.
The food is very authentic. I have the especial $4.99 for lunch. It includes 2 great tacos ans rice. The shopkeeper and chef were very nice and friendly. Great service. Highly recommend!

Read the reviews and walked over to this neighborhood taco/grocery store. Do people on yelp really think this is a five star place?  Yelp has got to start issuing credentials to review. Anyway, after reading the chorizo was amazing I got a hankering for a chorizo torta. Chorizo was average. Price $6.05, a little above average. People are super nice and I will come back to try the carnitas at $5.99 a pound!!

We stopped in here for lunch since we were in the area and saw it was nearby on yelp. We both got the 2 tacos with rice meal for 4.99 a plate. This was a great deal and a decent serving of food. I had two carne asada tacos. My husband had a tongue taco, al pastor, and a carne asada taco. There was a small upcharge on his since he had an extra taco and only chicken and steak are included in the special, but we did thoroughly enjoy our tacos. When asked if we wanted all the toppings we said yes because we kind of assumed it would only be cilantro and onion. However, they put cheese, tomato, lettuce, etc on our tacos, which was fine, but I think next time I would ask for just cilantro and onion. The meat was well seasoned and tasty. I want to try the fried chicken tacos if we're in the area next time. Also the owners were so friendly and kind. Great family business.
Great stop for some tacos and rice. I tried the chicken, barbacoa, and steak. All delicious at a very reasonable price.

Love this spot, was hesitant at first given its a grocery store but then I thought hey so is Bari, Al pastor burritos are absolutely on point. Good bargain at $6 an big portions, steak, barbacoa, and fried chicken tacos are also tasty. Perfect neighborhood spot.

i give them the full 5 stars because they are truly, truly authentic. the tacos are vey good and the rice and beans perfect. i always judge mexican restaurants by how serious they take the rice and beans. here you get unbroken pinto beans in a simple flavorful sauce and the rice is delicious and bright yellow as it should be. the best part of this wonderful experience is the happy family vibe. behind the bodega the father cooks at a nice clean old school grill behind a big window. there is seating right in front of him...sushi bar style...as well as some tables and chairs.  it's so comfortable and unpretentious you find yourself smiling at the cheetos and orange soda all around.  if you're sick to death of hip new anglo/mexican places you will love this family gem on a great side street in east village.

I'll never leave the neighborhood because of El Jardin. First of all the service. Everyone who works here is amazing, they take the time to introduce me to the foods and let me sample new dishes! The pork tacos are mind blowing. I love coming here on Sundays. Such an amazing, local gem. Thanks for everything!

The Order: Steak Burrito The Cost: $7.50/Burrito The Review: This is probably the best Burrito I have found so far in the city..... and I tried them all.  The meat is so flavorful and the portion size is HUGE.  It is normally around $5 a burrito, but I always upgrade and get extra meat to make it GIGANTIC.  They also include sour cream that you can exclude.  Don't expect the highest quality of meat, because one time I took apart the burrito and discovered some fatty pieces in there.  I guess that's why its so good.  Just love this place.

Amazing! A Family run taco joint nestled away on Huron street. Entirely unassuming storefront, I am so glad I stumbled upon this taqueria! I'm kind of confused about the negative review about the chicken burrito... I was cautious at first to order it as per previous user's recommendation. It was actually quite delicious, and pretty unique! You can tell it has a neighborhood feel, but you wouldn't be judged or made uncomfortable if it's your first time there, they'll make sure to make you feel at home. Delicious food, and it is at an incredibly fair price point.
We live just down the street and this is my favorite place to get an Al Pastor burrito and their street tacos are also great!

I moved about 10 doors down and never set foot in the place for over a year. A friend of mine finally insisted we go and wow, I was missing out for a long time. You can get a great al pastor burrito for $5. The tacos are served with onion and cilantro and that's all they need.  On the chicken side, it's chopped up fried chicken not traditional cuts. That said, it's pretty tasty. For a nice change of pace, grab the dinner plate or a milanesa torta.

Solid tacos and tortas with delicious meats or avocado fillings, though I've especially enjoyed the chorizo. This place isn't going to win any awards, but everything I've had here has been good, cheap, and simple. It's an ideal place to grab food when I want a quick bite that I know will be satisfying. An ideal neighborhood bodega.
Al Pastor taco perfection! Will definitely be going back to try the barbacoa and the chile rellano!
Best burritos and tacos in the city. I agree with other reviews. Skip the chicken. Steak and chorizo are excellent. Everything is made to order. Family run. Muchas gracias, Rigo, Alicia and family.

I laughed at the reviews before I came here and learned from my own mistakes even after reading them... Don't get the chicken burrito unless you want fried chicken on it. It wasn't even terrible... but I just generally don't eat fried chicken for health reasons and the menu doesn't even say "Fried Chicken Burrito". Dohhhh. You've been warned! On the other hand, my barbacoa taco was delicious and whatever my friend ordered was very good as well. They're so close to me I won't be able to resist coming back here. I also noticed that they sell avocados, tomatoes, and a few other convenient foods.

Been coming here for years, this place is authentic and friendly and has all around very solid execution on their food. GREAT carnitas, the tortas and tacos always deliver. Very good tamales (weekends only, as well as the carnitas). The rice and beans are almost the best part when your soul needs satisfaction. Mad love for my dudes here.
These are the BEST TACOS ever! I stop by about once a week to pick up some steak tacos and horchata. Super nice people and they even know my order.

Hands down the best tamales in the entire city of Chicago, quite possibly the best tamales in the state!!! Tamales only on weekends and the pork tamales are the best! Very nice owners and authentic Mexican food.

This place was BOMB. Wow, I wish I had come here sooner! This restaurant is really small and very authentic. When I came here, I had a carne asada torta. My boyfriend ordered the barbacoa torta and we ordered a red tamale and a green tamale. The tamales were so good that I wanted to order like 20 more. The carne asada was hands down the best that I have ever had. It was a little crispy and just super delicious. I will definitely be back soon!

Don't get the chicken burrito. I read great things on Yelp and decided to give this taqueria a try. My friend ordered a steak burrito and I got the chicken. His steak was freshly cooked from a beautiful looking marinade with onions diced in. Mine was fried chicken pulled out from a warmer and scraped off the bone. The cook let it sit on the grill for a few moments before tossing it into the burrito. I picked out several bones and lots of gristle throughout the course of eating half the burrito before finally giving up. My friends steak burrito was "good", but the chicken was without a doubt the worst I've ever had. On the plus side, it was only $5 for about a pound of food.
No frills Mexican at the party store. I LOVE IT! The burritos here are the bomb! Totally under the radar so there's never a wait. Just get it and go.

I have been here a couple of times.  Their tacos are pretty good. They also have menudo and carnitas by the pound on the weekends which are great for impromptu gatherings.   Their grocery selection is small but it's nice to have a place near by to pick up basic items like condiments, snacks, dairy, etc.

Taqueria is located on a small tree lined street near Ogden International School. It looks like a small neighborhood convenience store but inside is some of the best Mexican food I have had in Chicago! Great carne asada that has wonderful flavor. Their food is  never dried out and always tastes outstanding. Small selection of items served, but they make everything on the menu taste fantastic! In addition, Taqueria El Jardin is a great value, and great for children and groups.
Great hangover food and friendly service. This place has excellent and tasty tacos! Fast service with lost of random odds and ends.

These are my favorite chicken tacos in the city.  To me, they are just perfect.  I haven't met anyone who didn't like them. FYI this joint is a mixture of corner store and taqueria (if you want chips, you've gotta buy a bag of chips from the aisle).  The menu is pretty limited, but if you know what you're getting into, you'll be a happy customer.

Sticking with 4 stars. Went back for lunch today.  This time no sour cream on my tacos.  The steak tacos are BONGOS good!!! AND the waiter/chef guy in the back is my new best friend in Chicago.  Is it gluttonous if I go back for dinner too?

Not sure if it was because it was so late at night and they were probably closing up, but the taco and torta we got weren't 'awesome' as we had hoped. Tacos weren't too bad though and torta doesn't have avocado or beans included so we'll leave it at 3 stars and would return if we have to.

I've worked right by this place for almost a year, and finally went there for lunch after hearing only good things. It was pretty damn good. I got a steak burrito and pop for $6, that's a deal. The burrito was good, it came super fast, and the salsa was on point. It doesn't look like much from the outside (or the inside for that matter), but the food speaks for itself, loudly. Lunch or late night, el Jardin is a great way to go for good cheap mexican staples.

I live right next to this place and it's hard not to eat here once a week. The family that runs the place is a cornerstone of the neighborhood and has been through hell and back. I'm appreciative to have a small grocery store for staples - as well as a banging taqueria - right next door. They serve fried chicken in their burritos. Need you know more? The steak is also incredible. The tacos are fantastic and, strangely, the rice is probably my favorite rice I've gotten from any Mexican restaurant. It's a hole-in-the-wall, hidden-gem type deal. Avoid it during mid-afternoons (between 12-4) as it will likely be packed with kids from the school that's next door. They know what's up...this is awesome and cheap food made by a local family. Don't bother on Sunday afternoons, they close the kitchen early. Give it a try. I love it. Not for everyone, but if you're interested in taquerias it probably will be for you.

Muy Bueno! This little taqueria is one of those little hole-in-the-wall places that at first you are weary of but after you eat their food you're a fan for life. I recommend the steak tacos with Spanish rice on the side. The quality of the steak is excellent, the portion is generous and most importantly it's cheap!. Many of my coworkers eat here several times a week because they are close by and you can count on the food being great each time.  The owners also make you feel like family, every time I walk in they greet you like a friend with a smile on their face. Even though there are a myriad of Mexican food joints in the area this one is worth giving a try.

Who would have ever thought such yummy quality tacos could exist in a place as such. El Jardin is easy to miss driving down Huron, once you realize this is the place you then begin to question your sanity of eating from a place as such...HOWEVER the steak tacos are AMAZING! Oh and don't forget the Spanish rice. This is my go to lunch spot..$5 special incl/ 2tacos & cup of rice anytime of the day! I dare you say different!

I'd read other reviews about the potential for this to be a true hole in the wall. Sadly we were underwhelmed. The staff were friendly and the salsa tasty, but the meat was questionable (and I don't mean the pieces were unidentifiable, I mean it must have been sitting for a while at room temp). Very greasy too. The group of guys who came in flashing gang signs also kinda ruined it for us. Sad, because I've been looking for a bodega to call my own too :(.
Great mexican food, their tacos are just delish! And you can't beat the price. My new favorite mexican join in Noble Square!

It is trite to give the 'best kept secret' review, but this place really is the bomb. Family owned, great burritos and tacos, for a decent price. If you are in the neighborhood, you are a lucky person.

Good stuff.  Small selection of staples/grocery, and delicious & inexpensive prepared Mexican food.  Tacos and burritos are tasty, quick service, really friendly employees behind the counter all the time.  It's not going to be on Check Please anytime soon, and rightly so, but if you're in the neighborhood, give the veggie tacos and chicken burritos a try.

I ordered one chicken taco (I know, who orders one taco?), what I got was a meal. Not even kidding. Four tortillas, like a pound of chicken, toppings galore and 4 containers of salsa. I loved my chicken taco (meal)!  No frills, seriously. You are literally eating in the middle of this tiny store surrounded by drink coolers and shelves stocked with everything from potato chips to laundry soap. A true bodega. Spanish television blasting while people eat at what seem like card tables and a few stools looking into the grill area.  People come in to grab carnitas and chicken by the bucket full so I imagine that stuff tastes pretty good too. Prices are very cheap, especially for what you get.  They take credit cards with a small minimum. They didn't make a fuss about it at all but I must say that I felt kind of silly using my debit card in here for some reason...take cash if you can!
Great chicken and steak tacos! Too bad I don't work by this place anymore. I miss their tacos! Great family that owns this dive-y taco joint.

I wandered in here last weekend and ordered two tacos: one with skirt steak, and one with the weekend-only special roasted pork. Both were fantastic. The quality of the meat is unsurpassed. The homemade green sauce was fresh and delicious. They made two special-order veggie tacos for my husband, which he liked.  This place is the grungiest taco dive I've ever been to (so far), which is saying a lot since I frequent this kind of establishment. It's the perfect place to grab a casual, hangover-curing weekend lunch.

I love El Jardin.  Very nice people, very good food.  I'm"m about the taco's.  and the rice and beans are some of the most flavorful goodness.  It was my corner store until I moved away from the neighborhood.  I still go back for the tacos.

Oh boy nobody has reviewed El Jardin! We call it the "JARdin", pronouncing the "j" and stressing the first syllable.  I still haven't tried their tacos; I had their fried chicken once when REALLY hungover, but it wasn't anything special. We use it as a corner store. They have Gatorade and Tylenol packets for hangovers, a few kinds of cereal, a million kinds of chips (it's next door to a school), toilet paper (there's a stick with a hook hanging nearby to help you drag the rolls from the top shelf), canned goods, ramen noodles, Mexican seasonings (I've bought some as impulse buys, and they've been great!) dog and cat food, toiletries, dairy and eggs... you get the idea. You can get bags of ice in 3 different sizes; I just say "the $2 size" and get a Jewel-type shopping bag full of ice from their machine. Once you learn what they have, it's very convenient, just like any corner bodega... They close at 4 on Mondays, FYI.

Having a taqueria in what amounts to my front yard is stuff of dreams. The family/owners are simply lovely lovely people and they always have great tacos and imported Coca-Cola. Lovely lovely. I'll be in there tomorrow morning.
